wikipedia_page.main: Bobby Ford (born 14 December 1949) is a Scottish footballer, who played for Falkirk, Dundee, Montrose, Raith Rovers, Dunfermline Athletic and Meadowbank Thistle.

response: *Bobby Ford (Scottish footballer) (born 1949), played for Dundee FC

Born in Bristol, Ford began his career as a trainee at Oxford, signing a professional contract in 1992. In November 1997, Sheffield United bought him for £400,000. In 2002, he returned to Oxford on a free transfer, scoring once in his second spell at the club against Boston United, before retiring from professional football in July 2003. After a break from football, in January 2004 he signed for Bath City, where he spent almost two years, before retiring permanently.Bobby Ford  Bath City F.C.
